handlers.null: This controller is disabled and will appear as disconnected to software. Choose another handler to enable it.
handlers.keyboard: While it is possible to use a keyboard as a pad in RPCS3, the use of an actual controller is strongly recommended. To bind mouse movement to a button or joystick, click on the desired button to activate it, then click and hold while dragging the mouse to a direction
handlers.ds3_windows: In order to use the DualShock 3 handler, you need to install the official DualShock 3 driver first. See the RPCS3 Wiki for instructions.
handlers.ds3_linux: In order to use the DualShock 3 handler, you might need to add udev rules to let RPCS3 access the controller. See the RPCS3 Wiki for instructions.
handlers.ds3_other: The DualShock 3 handler is recommended for official DualShock 3 controllers.
handlers.ds4_windows: If you have any issues with the DualShock 4 handler, it might be caused by third-party tools such as DS4Windows. It's recommended that you disable them while using this handler.
handlers.ds4_linux: In order to use the DualShock 4 handler, you might need to add udev rules to let RPCS3 access the controller. See the RPCS3 Wiki for instructions.
handlers.ds4_other: The DualShock 4 handler is recommended for official DualShock 4 controllers.
handlers.xinput: The XInput handler will work with Xbox controllers and many third-party PC-compatible controllers. Pressure sensitive buttons from SCP are supported when SCP's XInput1_3.dll is placed in the main RPCS3 directory. For more details, see the RPCS3 Wiki.
handlers.evdev: The evdev handler should work with any controller that has linux support. If your joystick is not being centered properly, read the RPCS3 Wiki for instructions.
handlers.mmjoy: The MMJoystick handler should work with almost any controller recognized by Windows. However, it is recommended that you use the more specific handlers if you have a controller that supports them.
